title: Towards Text-Image Interleaved Retrieval
author: Xin Zhang (Harbin Institute of Technology), Ziqi Dai (Harbin Institute of Technology), Yongqi Li (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Yanzhao Zhang, Dingkun Long, Pengjun Xie, Meishan Zhang (Harbin Institute of Technology), Jun Yu (Harbin Institute of Technology), Wenjie Li (The Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Min Zhang (Harbin Institute of Technology)
relevance_why: The paper introduces a retrieval task that may provide insights into multimodal data interactions, which could inform new approaches in audio-visual processing tasks.
background: The task setting focuses on retrieving documents based on a query that includes interleaved sequences of text and images, contrasting with traditional methods limited to single-image queries.
contribution: This paper introduces the Text-Image Interleaved Retrieval (TIIR) task to solve the limitations of existing multimodal information retrieval systems, achieving significant improvements in retrieval performance using a novel Matryoshka Multimodal Embedder.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods are primarily designed for scenarios involving single-image queries, often failing to capture the context of multiple interleaved images and text.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by proposing the Matryoshka Multimodal Embedder, which effectively compresses visual tokens at varying granularity, enhancing efficiency and retrieval accuracy.

key_innovation: The unique compression of visual tokens allows the model to maintain effective contextual understanding while keeping the embeddings manageable.
real_world_impact: This research addresses a significant gap in multimodal retrieval, potentially improving applications in tutorials, medical diagnostics, and complex information retrieval tasks.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention any limitations.

new_terms.Text-Image Interleaved Retrieval: **Text-Image Interleaved Retrieval** refers to a new retrieval task where both the query and documents consist of interleaved sequences of text and images, requiring nuanced understanding to retrieve relevant information.
new_terms.Matryoshka Multimodal Embedder: **Matryoshka Multimodal Embedder** is a proposed model that uses a nested visual token approach to address the inefficiencies of previous methods that relied on a large number of visual tokens.

open_sourcing: Dataset and code will be released at https://github.com/vec-ai/wikiHow-TIIR
